alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, the public reported street flooding from heavy rain in Commercial Boulevard and State Road 7 due to thunderstorms. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Portions of northern and central Broward County are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Sea Ranch Lakes, Palm Aire, Broadview-Pompano Park and Godfrey Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
